2. Handuk cuma ada 4 (ada 3 kamar lo), Piring cuma ada 2 , sendok garpu kurang, sikat gigi cuma 4. Minta tambahan lama & musti berrrkali kali minta  (tapi dikasi, kita oke dengan ini, mungkin cuma kurang staff)

3. Yg paling parah tuh: POOL ! Kita pilih hotel ini karena anak2x mau Berenang , kolam nya bagus & gede, TAPI POLICY hotel super aneh: 1 apartemen  isi 3 kamar hanya dpt 4 access card / 4 orang dewasa aja yang bisa masuk area kolam (padahal kapasitas apartemen 6 org !!). Bahkan nungguin anak berenang aja GA BISA klo tanpa kartu. Policy yang gak logis
Trus GA ADA HANDUK POOL. (Jadi bukan fasilitas hotel, lebih kaya berenang di apartemen aja)

Jadi kalo kalian pesen apartemen :
1 kamar : dapet 2 Access Card & 1 Free parking
2 kamar : dapet 3 Access Card & 1 Free parking
3 kamar (kapasitas 6 org) : dapet 4 Access Card & 1 Free Parking
Sounds UNFAIR ?

Makesure sebelum kalian nginep sini mikir dulu berapa banyak org yg mau berenang / mau nyantai duduk2 family time di area pool 

Plus point:
1. Breakfast simple tapi enak. TAPI TANPA prokes, sendok garpu sempet dpt masi berminyak. Chaos & sering abis cutleries nya

2. Bed & pillows nyaman great quality

3. TV nya smua smart TV komplit ada YT & Disney+ segala.

4. AC dingin & hawa ruangan enak 

5. Shower water berasa luxurious, nyaman cepet panas/dingin juga

6. Pool nya guedeeeee & comfortable, hawa nya enakkkk & bersih  😍 berasa di dkt pantai . Bisa renang ama kids berjam jam disini

Smoga bisa membantu review sy.

text: We booked a 2-bedroom apartment and upon check in, was told the only apartment with a sea view was on the 3rd floor. I specifically asked if it was noisy since one side of the apartment faces the main road. The front desk ladies, Atik Nurjanah or Dhea Febriyanti told me it wasn’t. And they lied outright. The apartment had single glazing windows throughout but might as well have had no windows as the sealing was awful. We heard the screeches and horns of the tens and thousands of cars and motorbikes going by the bridge right on front of our windows at all hours till morning. We absolutely could not sleep. When confronted after 2 nights of sleeplessness, front desk admitted their mistake (Ie they lied) but said they could not move us to another apartment as they were full. We felt helpless and completely cheated. If you can’t sleep then what is the point of paying for a hotel room. I would also add that the services apartments are basically mixed in a tower with other privately owned apartments: the corridors are very bare and absolutely not what you expect from a property in the Ascot/ Oakwood stable Ie really no frills contrary to the pictures they show on the websites and here. Avoid this property with unethical staff and stay elsewhere.
title: Noisy, lying front desk, terrible

text: Mixed. The room was great, luxurious even. And it’s just twenty minutes by taxi from the airport. But on arrival — at 3:30 pm — our room wasn’t ready. We weren’t given clear directions to somewhere we could wait, or looked after, until we asked to speak to the manager (another long wait) and we were finally shown to an aircrew lounge and a manager took responsibility for sorting it out. Something like an hour and quarter after we arrived before we got into our room. I appreciate that the hotel had two flights arriving at once (it seems to be a place where aircrews stay between flights), but that’s for the hotel to manage. The staff were, eventually, apologetic and gave us a free breakfast the next morning, which we appreciated. (The offer of a late checkout was no use to us and presumably risks bouncing the problem to the next day’s guests). We’d paid the high-end price because we wanted somewhere comfortable and reliable to crash after more than 24 hrs of travelling: another wait for a shower and a change of clothes was exactly what we wanted to avoid. A sense that this may be a regular occurrence here. Other than that, not a bad choice.
title: Great room, but it wasn’t ready

text:
We want to share a very unpleasant experience at Oakwood PIK Apartment. Especially about guest car parking. 

We stayed at Hotel  on July 1, 2022. In the evening we left for dinner with guest parking tickets that HAD BEEN REGISTERED at the hotel. Around 10 pm we returned to the hotel and circled a few times looking for an empty parking lot finally we got a parking area for 1 car. 

The next day we checked out at 12 and headed for the car. What a surprise it turned out that our car was locked by the security building with the reason that we parked in the loading dock parking area and with the reason that our car number was "NOT" registered in the system. At that time we were immediately told TO PAY FINE OF Rp. 1.000.000,-(One Million Rupiah). 

We just realized that we parked at the loading dock because when we parked we didn't see the loading dock written on the parking floor (our car was a low sedan), and strangely there was NO PIN/CONE stating that the parking was not for public parking. Just like a trap.  And not even contact the guest via Hotel FO to move our car

We tried to explain what happened and refused to pay such a large fine.  This incident was not 100% the fault of the guest. 

The Building/Secure parking also doesn't seem to coordinate well with the Hotel to find out the Number of the guest's vehicle before locked the car and asked for fine. Even though our car number is already REGISTERED !!! as a hotel guest. 

After 5 tiring hours of waiting at the hotel, finally there was still no win-win solution from the hotel or the building management. We had to PAY A FINE 1 MILLION RUPIAH.

In the end, with a broken heart and tired, we transferred the fine of 1 million rupiah which was directly entered into the PPRS ACCOUNT.  then lock on our car was opened. You can imagine how we were being TREATED LIKE CRIMINALS. 

This incident has cost a lot of time, energy and LOT OF MONEY. It was traumatized for us by staying at Oakwood PIK Apartment, which turned out that the EASIEST TASK such as coordinating /cross checking the guest vehicle number between the Hotel Management and the building Security before taking action was NOT RUNNING WELL AND PROPERLY.
title: Be Careful Staying at This Hotel.

text:
Following my doctor’s suggestion that a vacation was in order for me I decided to take a trip to Indonesia. It was my good fortune to stay at the Oakwood Apartments in Jakarta at at Caribbean Tower. The price was attractive, with a continental breakfast buffet included and the balcony view of the pool was most impressive. The King size bed was meant for a king with the softest down pillows I have ever slept with.

The room I stayed in was exceptionally modern with all appliances included to make one’s stay as convenient as possible. There was the usual kitchen items such as sink, stove, microwave, and an ample supply of dishes and utilities but it was quite a surprise to find a brand new washing machine, a safe and iron board, hair dryer, electric iron and modern LED lights within the unit. 

Upon our arrival at the hotel, the lobby distinguished itself by being ultra modern with an elaborate supply of glass exterior walls and doors inside and outside and austere decorations to match. The elevators were super efficient and quick and the facilites were super clean. 

There is a restaurant on the premises as well as a family convenience store, indoor pool, outdoor pool, fitness center and a children’s play area. The spacious grounds were well manicured with the grandest collection of Indonesian plants, flowers and trees. Throughout the day you can see employees cleaning the premises, giving you the assurance that your health and well being was most important to management. This is particularly important now that we are coming out from the devastating effects of Covid 19.  

Market City, as well as fresh market, are just a few short blocks away so getting fresh vegetables, fruits. eggs, fish and meat to cook in the apartment was the easiest part of my stay. Maria. my Indonesian friend, host and guide, who accompanied me during my stay was also truly amazed with the general cleanliness of the room  and the efficiency of the housekeeping and engineering team in responding to any guest’s needs such as extra towels, or how to work the split level a/c system or resetting the phone or helping to speed up a slow draining bathroom sink.

Of course, a review of a hotel cannot be limited to just the facilities but also to the people who work there. Therefore, it would be remiss for me not to mention the wonderful hospitality that was extended to us by the entire front desk crew, so selfless in their desire to please. Case in point, I needed to find a money changer. Atiek not only gave me a good suggestion but actually walked over to the front door and pointed out exactly where to walk to get there, just after the mall on PIK. Such exceptional service was also demonstrated by Rio Barnas and Tama and again by Atiek who at various times helped me out in an emergency when I needed a few pages printed. 

I was truly blessed to have met these wonderful employees. I say thank you to all of them and in particular to Dea, Atiek, Tama, Avi, Rio Barnas, and Brigitha. Mr. Barnas and Atiek have helped to make my stay in Indonesia at the Oakwood Apartments in Gold Coast one of the most memorable of my trips outside of the United States and for this they truly should be commended. When I needed a ride to the hospital, Mr. Barnas and Atiek truly delivered.
title: Oakwood Apartments, Jakarta. Indonesia — Great People & Excellent Facility

text:
the check in process is a breeze, after calling them making sure what is the right time to check in we went there on 3pm and check in. The staff who helps carrying the luggage and stuff came after we wait a while, and they told us about having to take a covid 19 test since we booked the room more than 2 nights after I asked them several times, when they should've told me when I want to make the booking (yes, I called several times to make sure everything in order). The lift does takes a while but it's normal and we did have to take precaution according to the new normal regulation. 

The room is spacious and the decor is beautiful but the floor is so dirty, i have to mop everything by myself using the floor mat and kinda surprise looking how black the dirt are on the mat. it's like they never mop it before. There's washing machine inside our two bedroom apartment but they don't have a dryer like said on the website. Acknowledging the condition of the floor we wash every kitchen utensils we are going to use (yes, they do provide cups, plates, bowls, fork, spoon, even pots and pans) with electric stove. 

There's microwave as well but it is so dirty and filled with grease. Clearly they didn't clean it up after each guess like they said they did. On the TV the 'ad' of 3D cleaning is non stop but the fact that the top of the fridge (right behind the coffee maker) is filled with dusts and so does on the ornaments on the walls. And the fridge is not properly cleaned too. 

We don't mind that the room is not cleaned during our stay, but they should've cleaned it properly before each guess and I can't really say anything about whether they sanitize or not for the things we saw. 

The pool is great, huge space, but some part of the pool are a bit dirty ( like some people throwing tissue of stuffs inside the 90cm pool) but the rest is fine. The do close for public at 6pm. 

The gym and indoor pool is closed during our visit, and we didn't try their breakfast/restaurant too since the apartment is surrounded by many restaurants. 

The staffs that provide change of towels and tissues or cleaning up the thrash do come after being requested, it may take around 1 hour or so depends on how busy they are. And on the third day all our room keys (all 3 of them) suddenly stopped working and one of the staff said it because we put it near our phone which is nonsense, 1 of them stay stuck on e wall for 3 days without moving an inch and the rest is always away on phone, and the other staff said it's because of their system that automatically reset the cards after 3 days, so perhaps it would be a great idea to inform your guests about the cards system so we are not confused when locked outside our room.
title: the room could be a lot cleaner

text:
I have high hopes for this place since they carry Oakwood brand, but sadly this property fell below our expectation. We stayed in a two-bedrooms unit on 21st floor.

Pros:
- we had problems with TV and wifi, and it was resolved quickly.
- wifi was fast.
- drinking water dispenser was provided, along with Nespresso machine with 2 free pods. Kitchen was completed with plates, cups etc. enough for short stay.
- there's washing machine but we didn't use it. They provided hanging rack which we used to dry swimsuits.
- pool was big and very clean.
- location close to many eateries.

Cons:
- need to step up on cleanliness, there were still hairs and dirt when we arrived.. few strange spots on various places.
- no cleaning during the duration of stay. They only clean before and after you check out. But they would change towels, empty trash and replenish amenities daily (by request).
- breakfast was probably one of the worst we ever had in hotels, including from much cheaper hotels. We came down on the first day, the rest we bought food outside.

Really hope they can do some improvement.

text:
If you intended to have a leisure swimming staycation with your friends or loved ones - mind that the magnificent pool area only accessible with 1 access card = 1 person policy. Thus, if you stay in Studio Room you got 2 access cards , but if you stay in 2BR Apartment you only got 3 cards, and 3BR Apt only got 4 cards. Children can get in without separate access card from adult, so for 5yo and under its no prob but if you go with your fam/friend please consider what I mentioned above about the rule - since it's a bit unfair and absurd, or consider booking many studio rooms instead of 1 bigger apartment so you can get enough access card to the pool for everyone - Or just get in like you don't care since I saw many other guests did this LOL. (Not sure this is Covid19 situation only or they just plain weird when making this policy.)

And as many reviewer before me has mentioned, getting up to your room can be a hassle since access card always error and fail to tap to take us to our floor. In my case, only one out of four elevator that can read my card correctly. Imagine the wait for that ONE elevator. And yes, we tried to change the card, new card same old prob.

Lastly, even when we are about to leave.. we're still facing a problem. We have to pay for the parking fee. Of course we refuse to pay cause this is just too much already and ask the parking employee to clear things up with the receptionist. Sadly, because this is definitely NOT his fault.

Can't really say that I got the 5* Oakwood experience (I will give it for the room, yes Oakwood standard.. All sophisticated, edgy, and has everything you need) But I guess the whole area is actually run by other management (The G*ld Co*st) also.. all security I met on the area are plain rude? not sure why.. (Or was I just expecting a 5* service too much?)

By far, despite those three major concerns, I can say my check in/out experience was smooth, hotel location is top notch - a LOT of nice resto & shops within walking distance, stay in Studio Room and 2BR..both rooms are great - got the pool & sea view room absolutely a sight for sore eyes, staff at the Oakwood reception desk are nice.
title: Great room with lots inconvenience
